Representative_Docs: ['Janet Marie Flores Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Janet Marie Flores passed away peacefully on November 21, 2025 at the age of 94 surrounded by the love of her family. Jan was born on October 31, 1931 in San Francisco to loving parents Alice Detour and Joseph Hettrick. Jan was a loving mother, grandmother and great grandmother who found her greatest joy in her family. She had a way of making people feel welcomed. She was kind, big hearted, extremely gracious and devoted to those she loved. Her presence will be deeply missed. Jan lived a long life traveling, playing golf, bunco with her friends and one of her greatest talents was to find a treasure at garage sales. In her final years she enjoyed playing penny slots at the casino. The last nine years Jan spent in the loving care of her daughter and son in law. A special thank you to her granddaughter Samantha for making her last days warm, comfortable and full of love. Jan survived by her daughter Tina Schilling (Michael), her grandchildren Michael (Marissa), Paul (Kacie), Samantha (Carlos), and her nine great grandchildren Jackson, Aubrey, Jordan, Mikey, Ellie, Luna, Ryder, Makayla and Stella. And her friends who will forever cherish her memory. Celebration', 'Mary Kuljis Fiamengo Birth: 1934 Death: 2025 Mary Fiamengo passed away peacefully on November 6, 2025. Mary was born on September 20, 1934 in Komiza, Croatia. She was preceded in death by her beloved husband, Pete J. Fiamengo. Mary was a devoted wife, mother, sister, grandmother, great grandmother, aunt and dear friend. She is survived by her daughters, Deborah Dwight and Jennifer (Tim) Lovoy; her grandchildren, Peter Dwight (Cassandra), John Lovoy (Sloane), Ellen (Justin) Ralph and Lauren Dwight (Tim); her great grandchildren, Jordana Koonce, Hank Ralph and Margot Dwight and her sister, Betty Galosic. She was a long standing member of Mary Star of the Sea Church Velike Gospe Society, San Pedro Peninsula Cancer Guild and San Pedro Peninsula Hospital Bookworm Guild. Mary was a woman of grace, elegance and kindness; always extending a gentle word, a thoughtful gesture or a warm embrace. A memorial mass will be held at 10:30 am on Monday, November 17, 2025 at Mary Star of the Sea Catholic Church. In lieu of flowers, Mary requested that a donation in her memory be made to the San Pedro Peninsula Cancer Guild or to Mary Star of the Sea High School. Send Flowers Plant a Tree Send a Meal', 'Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser Birth: 1950 Death: 2025 Linda Sue (Jordan) Schlosser March 16, 1950-December 15, 2025 passed away peacefully surrounded by her family at her home in San Pancho, Mexico. Survived by her husband of 41 years, Phil Schlosser, her mother Gerry, daughter Kelly Noel, son Kevin Noel and wife Jennifer and her grandchildren Trevor and Lena. She was preceded in death by her father, Wayne Henry Jordan and brother Michael Wayne Jordan. Linda was born and raised in San Rafael, CA and graduated from Terra Linda High School. Linda loved sunshine, warm weather and travel. She was an outstanding cook and loved to entertain. Her great adventure was moving to Mexico, building a wonderful home filled with warmth, family, friends and great meals. She loved traveling throughout Mexico and Italy. Her family requests that gifts in lieu of flowers be made in Linda’s name to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. Forever deep in my soul, The memory of your love Fills my heart And I am never alone. Honor with Flowers In memory of Linda Sue Plant a Living Memorial In memory of Linda Sue']

Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: We’ve had a rough year. How do we tell family we want no gifts this holiday? Dear Eric: In a year that has been filled with not-so-great things,( family members being furloughed, health issues, rising costs) how does one tell the family you don’t want any gifts? My husband and I have plenty of things, we don’t need any things or clothing or food. In the past the family members have all planned lists. There are children that will get gifts from Santa but how do we tell the rest of the fairly large family that enough is enough? – Realistic Gift-Giving Dear Gift-Giving: Meet their lists with a list of your own. You can make a list of charities you’d like them to contribute to in lieu of gifts, or a list of gifts that can’t be bought, like quality time or homemade treats. Or your list can have just one item: “we have everything we could want. The shade defined as a black that reflects less than 0.5 percent of the light that hits it, is used on everything from telescopes to cameras. This uniquely dark color is not easy to produce and may appear less black when it is viewed at an angle. To find a better way to reproduce this cool color, a team at Cornell University looked to nature. Specifically, a bird called the magnificent riflebird. The result is the darkest known fabric ever created and it is detailed in a study recently published in the journal Nature Communications. The magnificent riflebird is a large songbird and member of the bird-of-paradise family found in New Guinea and Australia. Male riflebirds are almost completely black, with a green and blue metallic sheen on their belly, throat, and crown feathers. With the help of Mary M. Ferraro and Vanya Rohwer from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, the team studied the riflebird’s black feathers. Representative_Docs: ['‘UK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US’ People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. While seven in 10 supporters of Mr Trump felt this way, the figure was almost eight in 10 (79%) among Reform followers.
